revised_title: Dropsical Body Dissection by John Lafage
tldr: The author describes the dissection of a dropsical body, revealing a large quantity of viscous humor and numerous vesicles. The vesicles were found on the outer surface of the peritoneum membrane and inside, towards the intestines. The right kidney was affected by a specific dropsy, and two polyps were found in the heart, along with two large stones in the bladder.
